title: Daredevil skiers hurtle round blind bends as they zigzag down a stunning ice canyon in Chamonix
text:
This is the amazing moment two skiers take a spine-tingling plunge down an ice-encrusted canyon at the French winter resort of Chamonix.

The skiers drop into the narrow canyon and speed downhill between six-foot-high ice walls.

The chase begins with both adventurers leaping around three feet into the air after going over a small jump.

The chase lasts for almost 20 seconds when the second skier speeds around a corner to find their friend sprawled on the snow.

A pair of skiiers dropped into a narrow ice canyon in the Chamonix region of France

The pair raced each other down the twisting canyon in between six-foot ice walls

The chase came to an end when one of the skiers crashed at the end of the canyon

Fortunately no-one was injured in the incident.

Chamonix is in the French Alps and features Europe's tallest mountain, Mount Blanc which is almost 16,000 feet, as well as the world renowned White Valley glacier. Adventurers can go off-piste skiing on the glacier.

The area has been a winter sports destination since the 1740s and hosted the inaugural Winter Olympics in 1924.

The two daredevils aim towards small mounds of snow in order to propel themselves skywards

At one stage, one of the skiiers manages to leap approximately three feet into the air

Some five million people visit the Chamonix region each year during the tourist season

However, experts believe that climate change is threatening some of the glaciers in the Mont Blanc region.

Despite being a popular tourist destination, the area can be deadly with dozens of holiday makers being killed an seriously injured each year.

In 2012 nine climbers died after an avalanche on Mont Blanc. The dead, which included three Britons had been part of a team of 28 experienced climbers attempting one of the most dangerous ascents in Europe.

The climbers were faced with a wall of snow which swept them from the peak.

Last year, some seven skiiers died when they were caught by a storm while on the Haute Route, which begins outside Chamonix.

Each year more than five million people visit the Chamonix region, from people skiing in winter months to hikers in the summer.
description: This is the amazing moment two skiers plummet down an ice-encrusted canyon at the French winter resort of Chamonix.
